quiz.question: What condition does 'hypertension' describe in everyday medical language?
Which electrolyte imbalance causes muscle weakness and cardiac arrhythmias when low?
Which HIV test detects viral RNA directly to diagnose acute infection before antibodies appear?
Which term describes inflammation of the liver commonly caused by viruses or toxins?
Which bacterium most commonly causes community-acquired pneumonia in adults?
Which fetal chromosomal abnormality increases nuchal translucency and trisomy 21 markers on screening ultrasound?
Which organ system does 'pulmonary' relate to in medical terminology?
Which hormone released from adrenal medulla increases heart rate and blood pressure acutely?
Which acute leukemia predominates in children and shows TdT-positive lymphoblasts immunophenotypically?
What does 'antibiotic' primarily treat in clinical practice?
Which medical imaging modality is best for detecting acute intracranial hemorrhage quickly?
Which pathogen is identified by Gram-negative coccobacilli and causes whooping cough historically?
What does 'PCR' test detect when used in infectious disease diagnosis?
Which nutritional deficiency causes megaloblastic anemia with neurological symptoms when chronic?
Which criterion defines systemic inflammatory response syndrome using temperature, heart rate, respiratory rate, white cells?
